intro: Ranunculus echinatissimus, commonly known as the spiny buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a short, hairy stem that supports its basal leaves, which are palmately divided and covered in fine hairs. The flowers are typically yellow with a central yellow disk and are surrounded by 5 to 15 petal-like sepals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spiny bracts and is part of the Ranunculaceae family.
